p: Local adaptation in response to drought was suggested by the correlation between MAT p and among‐population variation of CS BAI–Temp.Jul ( t) (Fig. 4b), CS BAI–Drought.Aug ( t) (Fig. 5b) and CS BAI–Prec.Jul ( t) (Fig. S7). Provenances from warmer locations were less sensitive to summer drought in the common garden, suggesting that those provenances were more adapted to droughts (in agreement with Savva et al., 2002; McLane et al., 2011; Taeger et al., 2013; Montwé et al., 2016). Our study demonstrates the great potential of using CS derived from tree rings sampled in common gardens to investigate trees’ adaptive capacity to climate change, especially when testing provenances for suitability in future warming climates.
